snippet: Accused of political bias, the company offered details on how human editors and algorithms choose what appears — or doesn’t appear — in “Trending Topics.”
abstract: Facebook publishes its internal editorial guidelines as part of social media network's latest effort to confront accusations it is politically biased against conservative publications; guidelines show how both editors and algorithms play roles in news selection.

byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Accused of political bias, the company offered details on how human editors and algorithms choose what appears — or doesn’t appear — in “Trending Topics.”

headline.main: Facebook, Facing Bias Claims, Shows How Editors and Algorithms Guide News
headline.print_headline: Facebook Publishes Guidelines on the News
